intro: Danaea nigrescens, commonly known as the black-leaved torch flower, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling torches. Its leaves are typically dark green and glossy, turning a deep blackish-purple when mature. Danaea nigrescens thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
